page.title: 15SOUTH SHIELDS-METRO
page.content: CHICHESTER METRO STATION {Chichester Station}is right next to our school.Buses stop right outside the station so that people transfer from buses from the town suburbs to the {Metro}system. {The Metro Station}was recently built from 1981 to 1983.When they were building the metro a lot of our playground was destroyed and was made shorter.Workmen were always coming into our yard and this went on for months on end. {Chichester}is typical of most metro stations on{Tyneside}.There is easy access, a newsagent's shop, ticket machines and maps of the system.The stations are unmanned and everything is automatic.Once on the system you can transfer from train to bus or ferry.It is called an{Integrated {System.}A child pays only 5p fare.
